intro: Drummondita calida, commonly known as the hot drummondia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Drummondita calida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
